title: Video highlights UIC bioengineering department at ASEE annual conference in Florida | College of Engineering | University of Illinois at Chicago
contents: Skip to the content of this page ,  the main menu , the site search form , the site home page .           College of Engineering     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  College of Engineering      College of Engineering   Main Menu    Undergraduate           Admitted Student Information    Admissions    Advising    Career Outcomes    Diversity    Engineering Expo    FAQ    Majors and Minors    Paid Internships    Scholarships    Student Groups    Student Resources    Women in Engineering         Graduate    Departments    Research           Interdisciplinary Research    Labs and Centers         Support UIC           Donate Online    How to Give    Help Students    Empower Faculty    Capital Projects         About           Dean    Faculty    Administration    Staff    Alumni    Advisory Board    Facilities    Summer Camp    News    Contact          Eyebrow menu    Give    Careers    Alumni    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search                     Video highlights UIC bioengineering department at ASEE annual conference in Florida    Posted on June 19, 2019         Department of Bioengineering; University of Illinois at Chicago           Video highlights UIC Bioengineering department at ASEE annual conference in Florida   The Richard and Loan Hill Bioengineering Department is playing a starring role at the American Society for Engineering Education’s (ASEE) 126 th Annual Conference and Exposition in Tampa, Florida, through a film highlighting the department.  The video features interviews with bioengineering faculty and students and showcases the department’s labs and the University of Illinois at Chicago campus. The film will be played on screens and monitors throughout the Tampa Convention Center at the conference and on ASEE TV.  The conference brings together engineering education stakeholders from all disciplines to exchange ideas, improve teaching methods, and attend technical sessions. The conference is scheduled to run from June 15 through June 19.      Modified on August 10, 2019
